importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date when the incident occurred and when the police and public officials released statements regarding Doug Martin's death.
The date of Doug Martin's draft by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, marking the beginning of his professional football career.
The year Martin achieved significant stats and Pro Bowl recognition, highlighting his peak performance in the NFL.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This period represents Doug Martin's peak years in the NFL, during which he established himself as a top-tier running back with major achievements like Pro Bowl selection and All-Pro honors.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former NFL running back, died after being detained by Oakland police during an investigation into a break-in at a home in Oakland.
Martin had a distinguished career with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, including being selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft and earning Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors.
He amassed 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns over six seasons with the Buccaneers and one with the Raiders.
Martin's death occurred during a brief struggle with officers, with police stating he became unresponsive after being arrested early Saturday.
The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences to Martin's family, acknowledging his status as an Oaklander and community figure.
A cause of death has not been released, and an autopsy is pending.
Martin was recognized as one of the top 50 players in Tampa Bay Buccaneers franchise history.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central figure in the article, as the subject of the police detention and subsequent death.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional NFL football team based in Tampa, Florida.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The team where Doug Martin played the majority of his career and publicly honored him posthumously.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Law enforcement agency responsible for policing in Oakland, California.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The agency that detained Doug Martin and is involved in the investigation and public statement about the incident.

namedEntities.name: Barbara Lee
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She publicly expressed condolences to Martin's family, reflecting the community's response to his death and recognizing his local ties.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Official body responsible for investigating deaths and determining cause of death.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The office confirmed that an autopsy will be conducted to determine the cause of Doug Martin’s death.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The institution where Martin began his college football career and was drafted after standout performance.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The event where Doug Martin was selected 31st overall, marking the start of his professional career.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Annual NFL all-star game featuring top players from each team.

namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A designation given to the best players in the NFL by a panel of experts.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former NFL running back Doug Martin, best known for his time with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, died after a brief struggle with Oakland police during an investigation into a break-in at a home in Oakland. Martin, selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft, had a career marked by 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, earning Pro Bowl and All-Pro honors. He was transported to a hospital after becoming unresponsive during the arrest and later died at age 36. The Oakland Police Department and Mayor Barbara Lee expressed condolences, and an autopsy has been scheduled to determine the cause of death. Martin is remembered not only for his athletic achievements but also as a community figure in Oakland.
title: Former NFL Player Doug Martin Dies After Struggle with Oakland Police
